fields.description: Make it possible to use a swimlane in a kanban board to change or update a field in an issue? For instance I could configure a board so that it has swimlanes based on priority, or assignee, or team so that if I dragged the issue from one swimlane to another it would create, update, change or delete a value or attribute in an issue field?
fields.summary: Change field property based on swimlane

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, it may happen that an issue in the *Kanban Backlog* (Kanplan) has a higher rank then an issue shown on the *Kanban board* (issue in _Selected for development_, for example). 

h3. Suggested Solution
The customer would like to have the rank of the issues in Kanban Board to be higher then the issues in Backlog and calculated independently. 

h3. Possible Workaround
First move issues to top of Kanban Backlog and then move the issues to the *Kanban board* (issue in _Selected for development_, for example).
fields.summary: Improve ranking of issues in Kanban Backlog

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, in JIRA Software, if a smart commit fails, it fails silently without any error message displayed.

h3. Suggested Solution
Send a notification to users when a smart commit fails.
fields.summary: Notify users when smart commits fail

fields.description:
h3. current situation
At the moment, admins are not able to set default board columns upon creation. It will by default be using the "To Do" - "In Progress" - "Done" format

h3. suggestion
Allow a global configuration to set default board columns configuration

h3. why is this important
There might be occasions where a team or company has a default board columns format they'd like to follow. Since we can't set a custom default, they have to make the change one by one.
fields.summary: Allow Admin To Set Default Board Columns Upon Creation

fields.description:
{panel:title=Resolved|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ff7f7f|titleBGColor=#ff7f7f|bgColor=#e5e5e5}

The integration with the official GitHub application is now completed  and the authentication is now being managed directly by GitHub

{panel}

h3. Problem Definition

The current integration with Github only uses user based rate limit which causes the limit to be reached easily specially when the user does some API requests that adds to the limit.
h3. Suggested Solution

The support of Github Apps that will give it's own [rate limit|https://developer.github.com/apps/building-integrations/setting-up-a-new-integration/about-choosing-an-integration-type/] outside of user scope. Also, no need for separate webhooks for every repo when using github Apps.
h3. Workaround

Stop requests whenever it's close to hit the github limit.
fields.summary: Support of Github Apps in DVCS instead of user based OAuth

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

*Boards not accessible* shows information about boards from Inactive Users using private filters. 
The administrators do not have permission to check this information to be sure if they can safely delete this board. 
It creates a lot of noise in the *View all boards* page and it can be confusing for the users. 

Another improvement that could be added to the view all boards page is the addition of filters for the bords.
The addition of filters for owner, location, project would be most welcomed.

h3. Suggested Solution

Help administrators understand which filter is used for which board, which would make the decision of whether to remove a board easier. 
Implement filters to the board page that would help admins search easily for filters.
fields.summary: Improve "View all boards" page

fields.description:
h3. Problem Description

Wrong Component added in Issue Creation Screen.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Have a project with 2 Component (ie. Sunny and Moon)
 # Create 2 filters with each component
 ** Component = Sunny
 ** Component = Moon
 # Create 2 boards with the above filters (Sunny Board and Moon Board)
 # Open Moon board and create a new issue (the issue will have Moon component automatically)
 # In the list of board within the same project (left sidebar), open the drop down and click Sunny Board
 # Once Sunny board is open, create a new issue from inline issue or press c

h3. Actual Result
 * Moon component is shown automatically
 * !image-2017-12-02-00-02-28-612.png|thumbnail!

h3. Expected Result
 * Sunny component should be shown
fields.summary: Wrong Component added in Issue Creation Screen

Thanks for Greenshot, it is a great tool that I use as much as possible. I have a suggestion that I feel would be a great addition to an already wonderful product, Hot Keys for the Effects section.

I develop documentation on a regular basis and use the drop shadow effect as a visual enhancement on each screen capture. Being able to do a keystroke combination (or assign a key combo) would save me quite a bit of time in this development process. Thanks for considering this enhancement. 

Mark
fields.summary: Effects Hot Keys

fields.description:
*Problem Definition*
Jira can't sum the story points in the backlog, and for each status, and show the story points in a cumulative flow diagram.

*Suggested Solution*
The story points should be sum for issues done, in progress, todo,... There should be a cumulative flow diagram to show the story points.
fields.summary: Show sum of story point for each status of the issues

fields.description:
*Issues while using the swim lane view of the Kanban board*
 * Stories without subtasks are displayed at the bottom, even if they are of higher priority than other stories
 * Only subtasks can be dragged and dropped within the swim lane, updating story status is a hassle

*Suggestion to resolve this*
 * Always display a swim lane for a story, even if it has no subtasks
 * Have a shadow task for the story in the swim lane to allow easy story status manipulation
 * Hide the story shadow task if the lane is not empty, display it if it otherwise would be empty
 * Have a "display shadow task" toggle close to the story (possibly directly besides the "Toggle swimlane visibility")
fields.summary: Display shadow item for Stories in the Swim Lane by Story view of the Kanban board

fields.description:
h3. Problem:
When you don't have permission to set an Epic link (edit permission is necessary on the project of the Epic ticket) JIRA does not show any errors, does not display any indication of the lack of permission.

h3. Solution
A) A user should be able to link issues to epics regardless the permission to edit the epic, considering the epic is listed in the "Epic Link" field.

B) Improve error message displayed when the user doesn't have permission to link an epic, insert a message warning that the user does not have permission, what permission the user needs and in what project.

h3. Workaround:
You have to check with permission helper if user has edit permission on the project and check in the documentation that he needs that permission to edit issues: [Adding an Issue to an epic|https://confluence.atlassian.com/agile/jira-agile-user-s-guide/working-with-epics/adding-an-issue-to-an-epic]
fields.summary: Missing error message when setting an epic link without edit permission on the epic's project

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Card colors will not load if there a is a queried project that you do not have access.

h3. Steps to replicate
# Create a new board.
# Configure some card colors.
# Create one card color where project = X.
# Make sure that you do not have access to the project X.
# Open the board, none of the colors will load.

h3. Expected Result
The board will load the card colors.

h3. Actual Result
No colors are visible on cards.

h3. Workaround
Remove the queried project or grant access to the user for the specific project.
fields.summary: Card Colors doesn't work if it's based on queries and the user does not have access to the queried project.

fields.description:
At the moment, it is not allowed to drag and drop multiple issues at one time if the destination column is mapped to workflow status with a transition screen configured. This requires users to drag and drop issues one at a time.

To replicate :

- Configure the Done status to have a transition screen in the workflow.
- Map the Done status to a Board column
- Try drag and drop multiple issues at one time to that board

Result :

Message : Unable to transition multiple issues to Done. The transition screen is not supported when transitioning multiple issues.

 !drag.png|thumbnail! 

It would be useful to allow this feature for cases where a bulk update of issues is needed on Software boards.
fields.summary: Allow transitions for multiple issues on status with screen

fields.description:
In the new Test Cycles layout, in the Cycle Summary dropdown, the test cycles often don't load after being searched for. *This happens very often (40-60% of the time).*
	
For example, I opened up the cycle summary and typed in "Nov21", part of a cycle. The folder comes up, indicating that the cycle was found, but the open arrow does not appear, preventing me from opening the cycle. I've tried double-clicking the cycle name, re-searching for it, reloading the page, waiting for several minutes etc. Nothing seems to consistently allow the cycle to open. 
	
This bug disrupted our weekly testing last week as about a third of the testers were unable to view unexecuted tests.
fields.summary: Sometimes test cycles do not load when searched for

fields.description:
As a tester in JIRA, I want to be able to open test cases in tabs so I can quickly and easily move from one test to another and back.

In the old version, test cases could be opened in tabs by right-clicking the little "E" button. This made it very easy to check in on other tests, open my neighbors test to verify a bug, or otherwise move between test cases.

In the new version, test cases open underneath the cycle, meaning only one case can be opened at a time. If I'm working on a test and I want to look at another test, I have to leave my test (or open a new tab and work my way all the way back through the cycle to the new test)

This ends up costing us efficiency when testing.
fields.summary: Allow test cycles to be opened in tabs

fields.description: As a user, I would like to the ability to search/filter by using the CONTAINS ('~') operator for the component field
fields.summary: Filter by CONTAINS ('~') operator for the component field

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When we are trying to see the list of commits related to a ticket by clicking on the "commit" button under the development panel, "Unable to retrieve commit information" message will be shown after 10 seconds of waiting. This issue is intermittent.

h3. Environment
* Jira Software Cloud
* Connected to Bitbucket Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Have a ticket connected to several commits
# Try to click on the commit button under the "development" panel

h3. Expected Results
The list of commits will be shown

h3. Actual Results
The following error is thrown in the web browser's console:
{code}
{"errors":[{"instance":
{"singleInstance":true,"baseUrl":"https://bitbucket.org","name":"Bitbucket","typeName":"Bitbucket Cloud","id":"bitbucket","type":"bitbucket"}
,"error":"timeout after 10000ms, not getting from cache"}],"detail":[]}
{code}
And the following window is shown:
 !unable-to-contact.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes
This issue happen intermittently

h3.Workaround
Keep refreshing the page or try again at a later time, and the list of commit will be shown
fields.summary: "Unable to retrieve commit information" message appear when checking Bitbucket Cloud commits in a Jira issue

fields.description:
h3. Problem Description

Clicking parent task in a board doesn't open the Issue Details View if one of Assignee is selected from the drop down.
 - !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!  

h3. Steps to reproduce
 # Ensure you are 'Experiencing the new Jira' aka ADG3
 # Have a board with Stories as swimlane
 # Create a Story with Subtask
 # Assign the Subtask to a user (ie. John) while leaving the Story unassigned.
 # Drag and drop the Story to a Sprint and start it.
 # In Active Sprint, select one of the Assignee (ie. John)
 # Attempt to click the parent task

h3. Expected Result

Issues Details View is open
h3. Actual Result

Nothing happens.
h3. Workaround

Untick the Assignee.
fields.summary: Issue Details View isn't open if Assignee is selected

fields.description:
This is a simple feature that I have wanted to see in loads of products, not just in the Atlassian suite.

When an object (eg. an Issue in Jira) is created and some content is added to the Description field (aka. 'Notes', 'Summary', etc. in other places), it's not always obvious from looking at the title of the object that there is more reading to be done.

To explain: say I create an Issue in Jira and I write some useful text in the Description. When I see the Issue listed in the Backlog, Sprint, Dashboard... wherever, I have to click on it to see if there is any further information I need to know (ie. the description). A tiny icon on the Issue to denote that the Description field is not empty would solve this, and prompt people to click on it to read the important info.

Make sense?
fields.summary: Icon to show that an Issue has content in the Description field.

fields.description:
Epic name is a required field to create Epics in JIRA Software.

For some users, the Epic name have the same value of the issue's summary.

As a user, I would like to have the ability to hide the Epic name and copy the value from the issue's summary when creating a new Epic, instead of have to insert the same value two times.
fields.summary: Add the ability to hide the Epic name and automatically copy the value from the Summary field.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

On Kanban boards, the feature _Top of backlog_ sends the issue to the bottom if the first issue on the list is a sub-task
h3. Environment
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open a Kanban board
 # Map a status to the backlog
 # Add a issue with sub-task to the backlog
 # Transition the parent to another status
 # Move the sub-task to the top of the list
 # Right-Click on another task
 ## of the backlog and
 ## not in the backlog
 # Select _Top of backlog_

h3. Expected Results

The issue is ranked to the the top of the backlog.
h3. Actual Results

The issue stays in its previous ranking if it was already in the backlog.

The issue is ranked to the bottom of the backlog if it was not already in the backlog.
h3. Notes

*
h3. Workaround
 * Remove the sub-task from the top of the backlog list
fields.summary: Top of backlog sends the issue to the bottom if the first issue on the list is a sub-task

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Jira Labs new Issue detail view popup feature does not honor the field layout defined for that board


h3. Environment
Jira Software Cloud instances, where the user profile has enabled the Jira Labs feature: Issue Detail view.  This causes the issue details to appear as a popup window instead of on the right side of the window.


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a sample Scrum board in Jira Cloud
# Add a custom field to this board:   Board -> Configure Board -> Issue detail view, add custom field

h3. Expected Results
This new custom field should appear on the issue details view


h3. Actual Results
The field does not appear on this new view.
 
h3. Notes
Disabling the Jira Labs feature will allow that field to appear correctly.  It appears that this new labs feature does not take into consideration all the fields that are set to be displayed here.

h3.Workaround
Disable the Labs feature.   This can be done either by going to your user profile, clicking on your avatar in the top right of the screen and selecting Profile, then flipping the switch for this Jira labs feature OR you can click the leave feedback button that appears on this issue details view to both leave a comment about this feature and disable this feature that way.
fields.summary: Jira Labs new Issue detail view popup feature does not honor the field layout defined for that board

fields.description:
See the attached image. This interaction happens when leaving a comment on a task screen. When applying a external link to highlighted text, the text remains highlighted. It would be nice if the example url was highlighted by default.

To recreate:
 # Write some text in a comment.
 # Highlight some text.
 # Add an external link.
 # Text remains highlighted.
fields.summary: After applying an external url to highlighted text, the placeholder url should be highlighted

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Smart commits are not working for Github integration.
The commits are shown on the Development Panel however if a comment is added to the commit message, this comment is not added to the issue. Also, if the workflow has a transition with trigger, the transition is not performed.

h3. Environment
* JIRA Cloud integrated with Github

h3. Steps to Reproduce
* Perform a commit with a message. e.g.: KEY-1 # comment test
OR
* Add a trigger to transition issue when a commit is done

h3. Expected Results
Commands added to the commit message are performed

h3. Actual Results
The commit is listed on Development Panel but the commands on commit message fail
 
h3. Notes
* 

h3.Workaround
*
fields.summary: Smart commits are not working for Github integration

fields.description:
I'm trying to use a tool called Azuqua to sync data from Workfront with Jira.  Most of the data is integrating correctly - updating WF fields get updated in Jira tickets and vice versa.  However there are three fields in Jira that aren't getting updated when we update them in Workfront.

Three fields that cannot be edited by the API:

Start Date, End Date, and Original Estimate

We can edit these fields on the screen in Jira, but when we attempt to pass these values from Workfront (using the tool Azuqua Flo's), we get an error back.  We even tried passing in custom id's and both gave us the same error.

Here is the error in Azuqua.  We are suspecting that something on the Jira side is blocking passing the values.
 "message": "Cannot read property 'operations' of undefined",
 "_error": true,
 "method": "HyL-nH5yM",
 "flo": 39493,
 "execution": "8acf464f-eeb8-47f9-81a7-c5ad92bb1e8f",
 "code": 500



Note: Other fields in Workfront like Name of Project and Description of project get passed successfully over to Jira but something seems different with the start and end date and original estimate fields in Jira.
fields.summary: Fields can be edited on the screen but not through the API

fields.description:
Hi Atlassian,

As Marketplace -add-ons- [Apps Vendor|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/vendors/1210856/broken-build] I'd like to be able to create new -gadgets- dashboard items and reports which operate with velocity of completed sprints. Just a couple of existing Jira Software Server examples are [Velocity Chart|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/net.brokenbuild.velocity-chart/server/overview] and [Agile Reports|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/net.brokenbuild.agile-reports/server/overview] and there is no easy way to port them to Cloud.

I think that not only Apps Vendors but regular Jira Customers will also get a huge benefit from the possibility to create small custom home-made reporting tools based on Velocity data.

The workaround to perform own sprint velocity calculation based on sprint issues history is possible, but there is a high chance of difference between values in native Jira Software reports and custom calculation due to quick complex logic behind it.

And lastly Jira Software without Velocity wound't be truly Agile )

Regards,
 Vasiliy
fields.summary: Public REST API for completed sprint Velocity (both committed and completed)

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Component or fixVersion does not get assigned to issues if the Component or fixVersion name is used in another Project:
 * when the Board filter references the Component or fixVersion
 * created via Inline issue create when Quick Filter(s) referencing the Component or fixVersion are selected on the board

h3. Environment

Atlassian Cloud
h3. Steps to Reproduce

For Board filter case:
 # Create a project A and create a Component (or fixVersion) with name "XXX"
 # Create a project B and create a Component (or fixVersion) with name "XXX"
 # Create a board whose Board filter references the Component (or fixVersion):
 ** {{ project = A and component = "XXX"}}

For Quick Filter case:
 # Create a project A and create a Component (or fixVersion) with name "XXX"
 # Create a project B and create a Component (or fixVersion) with name "XXX"
 # Create a board from one of the projects and create a Quick Filter referencing the Component: (or fixVersion)
 ** {{component = "XXX"}}
 # Navigate back to the board and select the newly created Quick Filter

h3. Expected Results

Creating an issue on the board via Inline issue create should automatically assign it to the component "XXX".
h3. Actual Results

The issue is created with a note that it is not currently visible on the board. When viewing the issue the Component (or fixVersion) field is empty.
h3. Workaround

Have Components and fixVersions using unique names.
fields.summary: Issue is not populated with fixVersion or Component fields when the field name is non unique across Projects

# Use the old JIRA experience
# Create two software projects : Project A and Project B
# Create board 1 in project A
# Copy board 1  - Name it as for example board 2
# Update the location of board 2 to Project B
# Go to Project B

h3. Expected Behavior

Project B will show board 2

h3. Actual Behavior

Board 2 is not visible in project B. It is still shown under project A

h3. Workaround

In the new JIRA experience, it is working as expected. Use the new JIRA experience to view the project. The board will be shown under project B correctly
fields.summary: Updating board location on a copied board is not working in the old JIRA experience

fields.description:
Currently, when creating a new issue it always starts with the same status as determined by the current workflow.  But this behavior often doesn't make sense.

Example:  We have 2 agile boards.
 * *Dev:* Used by the engineering team.  Backlog is To Do (e.g. "ready for development) and the rest of the columns represent the process of getting to done.
 * *Backlog:* Used by product management.  Backlog is "Raw Feedback" and statuses represent the process of getting to "To Do"

 

Let's say our workflow default status is To Do.  This works well when the Dev team needs to split a story or add a new task that comes up during development - the new issue appears in the Backlog ready to go.  But when product management tries to add a story to their board, it's default status is "To Do" so they get a popup from JIRA: "Issue (ID) successfully created but not currently visible" – they need to follow the link, change the status, etc., for each story they add.

If we set workflow default to "Raw Feedback", it works for product management, but then developers have the opposite problem.

My recommendation would be:
 *  When user is viewing a specific board and adding a story (for example, using the "add issue" dialog in the backlog), use the status for that board's backlog (first step in that board's process).  If there are multiple statuses configured for the backlog, either choose the first or let the user specify which makes sense.
 * On screens that aren't in the context of a specific board, fall back to the workflow default.
fields.summary: Set Status for New Issues Based on Current Board

fields.description:
{quote}{color:#FF0000}*Work In Progress*{color}
{quote}
h1. User Story:

As a Scrum Master, I want to be able to clearly see the difference in initial commitment and the total commitment at the end of a Sprint, so that I can visualize scope creep.

 
----
h2. Current Implementation Issues:
 # I can only see a Sprint's commitment value after the Sprint has been Completed.
 # If I want to see scope creep visually it is not possible through any reports to see it as a separate chunk.
 ## Think of Stacked Bar Graphs as an example.

----
h2. Acceptance Criteria:

 
 # Each bar should be split into two shades of their respective color representing values:
 # Commitment at Sprint Start and Sprint Close + Completed within the Sprint
 In the numerical table under the chart, each column could simply have 2 values, one as is and the second in parentheses directly behind it:
 ** Commitment at Sprint Start + total Commitment at Sprint End
 ** Completed within the Sprints time being open + Completed without the Sprints time being open
 *** The later would include: Completed while having the Sprint value of X but not having any other value in openSprints() as well if it were completed while being in closedSprints() and having Sprint value of X while X is in futureSprints().
fields.summary: [Reports - Velocity Chart] Display Comparison of Commitment at Start and Completion Times

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
In the new Jira Experience, there is a change in how Quick Filters appear in boards:
* In old Jira: quick filters appear as a clickable link on top of the boards
* In new JIra: quick filters appear as a dropdown. You need to click on the dropdown, and then only you can see and click on the quick filters.

h3. Why is this important
This new change adds an extra click for the customer, and no longer as it used to be. This is especially impactful when a user is using a touch-screen only machine, where keyboard shortcuts can be used.

h3. Suggested Solution
Bring back how quick filters look in old Jira, or perhaps provide users an option to either show dropdown or show list like the old ways.
fields.summary: As a Jira Software user, in the new Jira UI, I want to have the option to see the quick filters in boards as they are displayed in the "old" Jira UI

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Sub-tasks without a rank get duplicated when transitioned through a board.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Import sub-tasks through CSV
# Access them directly into a board without accessing 
# Transition one of the imported sub-tasks on the board

h3. Expected Results

The issues should be transitioned fine and a rank entry created for it.

h3. Actual Results

The issue is transitioned and two rank entries are created which makes the issues to appear twice on the board and/or cover all the board columns:
!dupl.png|thumbnail!

h3. Notes

Running a rebalance of the rank won't fix the problem and the integrity check of the lexo rank won't find the current problems.
For now, the issue was only reproducible with the *Sub-Tasks* issue type.

h3.Workaround

Use the following JQL to find the affected issues:
{code}
rank = null
{code}

*For the workaround to take effect you must select the Rank field as one of the displayed columns*.
Simply by loading the issues through the search issue page should create their rank, to confirm this a reload of the page shouldn't return the same issues that were loaded before(This will only help in case you haven't transitioned the sub-tasks yet).

For cases where the above workaround doesn't work or the board is already showing two entries for the issues please contact Atlassian support.
fields.summary: Issues that have been imported, have no rank on boards and transitioning duplicates them

fields.description: Currently quickfilters must be maintained for each board. Our company has many boards and we like to do things such as creating quickfilters for releases. This means that every time we have a change to one board we have to manually update all the boards. We would like a way to share quickfilters across boards similar to how we can have shared searches.
fields.summary: Shared quick filters across boards

fields.description:
Use Case:

* an agile board Board X is defined based on filter "label = foo"; horizontal swimlanes in the board are based on Epics
* Story 1 has label foo on it; Story 1 is in Epic A; Story 1 is in the current Active Sprint
* Epic A does NOT have label "foo" on it

*Expected Behavior:*

It *used* to be the case (approx. 5-12 months ago) that while Epic A wouldn't appear on Board X, Story 1 *would* appear in both the Board X Backlog and Active Sprints views, and in the Active Sprints view Story 1 would be displayed in a swimlane at the bottom named "Issues without Epics". This should still be the behavior but is not, which places a frequent burden on us to chase down stories that are not appearing in the Active Sprints view but should be.

*Actual Behavior:*

Epic A doesn't appear on Board X; Story 1 does appear in the Board X Backlog view but does NOT appear in the Board X Active Sprints view.

If I were to then modify Epic A to have label "foo" on it (but not add it to the Active Sprint), the Epic would appear in the Board X Backlog view and now Story 1 *would* appear in the Board X Active Sprints view in the bottom swimlane named "Issues without Epics.
fields.summary: Unable to see a story in active sprints when its Epic doesn't meet the Board's filter constraints

 !image.png|thumbnail! 
 !image.png|thumbnail! 
 !image.png|thumbnail! {code}
And the JIRA report will include 4 copies of the SAME image rather than different images.
fields.summary: Pasting severals screenshots to jira issue results in same image.png filename

fields.description:
h2. Problem Definition

Currently only users who have Schedule Issue permission and Edit Issue permission can add / remove issues to / from sprint. These permissions are also required for ranking issues. Problem arises when the customer needs a specific user to be able to rank issue, but not add / remove issues to / from sprint.

As mentioned in [JSW-5035|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-5035?focusedCommentId=872704&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels%3Acomment-tabpanel#comment-872704], there was a discussion to consolidate the add or remove an issue from sprint into the Manage Sprints permission. However, it has been determined that it is not a workable solution.

h2. Proposed Solution

To have a separate permission for adding / removing issues to / from sprint so that it is a separate from ranking issues
fields.summary: To have a separate permission for adding / removing issues to / from sprint

fields.description:
Right now, it is necessary to have admin privileges for the Github repositories to link it with JIRA.

As a user, I don't want JIRA to have admin privileges under my repositories, I want to have the option to create this integration with a read-only access.

It is known that JIRA won't be able to perform workflow triggers without the admin access in Github.
fields.summary: Integrate JIRA with Github without the need of admin access in Github.

fields.description:
h2. Problem Description

Releasing issues from Kanban takes a while (up to 1 minute) even releasing a small amount of issues (10-60 issues)

h2. Steps to Replicate

The condition to hit into this bug is subjective to the scaling of the instance. If the instance is having a lot of issues, the delay is more easily seen.

# Navigate to Kanban board
# Release issue

h2. Expected Result

It should be released under 10 seconds for 5-15 issues

h2. Actual Result

It potentially hits into 20 seconds mark

h2. Additional Information

* Discovered when releasing 45 issues, took approximate 1 minutes to complete the release
* If you run a test on a fresh instance, it will only take 5 seconds. As it only affects scaling instances
fields.summary: Releasing on Kanban is Slow Even with Small Number of Issues

fields.description:
Using the new JIRA UI, when I create a new issue using the "plus icon" in the left menu, the issue is created under a selected issue in the board's backlog.

Using the "plus icon" in the left menu, I want issues to be created at the bottom of the backlog.
fields.summary: As a Product Owner, I want issues created in the left menu to be displayed at the bottom of the backlog
